pages.text: Looking above your level in the xp bar you will notice a little person thing, It's here to help you know how the actual temperature will affect you.$(br2)They will start getting $(9)blue $()& $(1)bluer $()the more cold it is, this is until you start freezing.

When you start freezing the person icon will become a circle, then when that circle fills up you will start taking damage.$(br2)Meanwhile in hot temperatures they will start getting $(c)red $()& $(4)redder, $()this is until you start overheating.$(br2)While overheating the icon will become a dark overlay of a flame, and when it fills up will you start taking damage.$(br)(Hot temperatures affects your thirst bar as well.)

pages.title: Dealing with the cold
pages.text: The cold can be tamed by staying near a campfire, but of course you dont want to be stranded by a campfire the whole winter.$(br2)Any leather or wool derived armor will help you with that, you can also insulate any armor with any bear fur.

pages.title: Dealing with the cold
pages.text: You can also get Heating Stones in a stonecutter, and heat them in a furnace.$(br)They will keep you warm while you carry them in your inventory.

pages.title: Dealing with the heat
pages.text: While in the heat you can make an Ice Pack, it will keep you cold in hot environments while in your inventory.$(br2)Just don't forget to refill it, be with ice blocks or snow ones.
